messages.message: I just went into my personal AI Hub account (<mailto:chris.maertz@gmail.com|chris.maertz@gmail.com>) and went to account settings. I was prompted to turn on MFA. I chose SMS, entered my phone number and now 5 minutes later have not received a code via text.
stuck here
cc @Xindi Xu @Heymian
I believe this is currently broken and being tracked <#C05TNBDJ56G|>. I believe the workaround before this gets disabled is to not chose SMS as the option

Yea, we removed the required MFA restriction so new users who signed up won't be prompted to set up their MFA. For existing users who set up MFA with SMS, we removed their MFA info, so they won't get prompted to verify their MFA upon log in.
@ChrisM which env is this?
instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
I don't know if we did the same thing for instabase.com (http://instabase.com). Let me check with the team
OK. I just clicked back to "Account Settings" and it puts me back in the "Setting up MFA" screen.

> instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
Do you mean the IB main platform or aihub?
@Xindi Xu I mean AI Hub public, production instance.
Here is the URL I'm currently at: https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/mfa?next=/hub/mfa
As a non-internal user, I wouldn't know that SMS is not working and I shouldn't select it as a workaround.
I see. Then all accounts should have MFA via SMS disabled. You don't have to set up SMS
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05TNBDJ56G/p1695673335532049
OK. Shouldn't we remove SMS as an option for anyone who lands on this page?
As a way to get around it, I chose "None", then I confirmed that I want to proceed without MFA and it returned me back to this page.
We cleared up accounts only on AI Hub prod. We didn’t touch instabase.com (http://instabase.com) because that’s actually largely an internal only environment. (I know the name prod is misleading)
I'm confused. What is the URL for AI Hub prod?
https://aihub.instabase.com/
aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) - this is our only multi-tenant public facing environment
That is the environment I'm in. I signed up using a personal account.
Oh I see, you are on AI Hub. Let me PM you to get your phone number.
It's <tel:+14148588049|+14148588049> (its on my Slack profile, so need to DM  me). :slightly_smiling_face:

BTW, I selected "None" again (on the screen above). Again clicked "Confirm" on the "Are you sure you want to disable multi-factor authentication?". This time I was taken back to home page. When I tried to go back to "Account Settings" I'm again prompted to setup MFA.

Yup, I think we have a bug here. Since we disabled MFA in this environment we should not be prompting anyone to setup MFA. We’ll look into this more.

@Xindi Xu can you take a look to see if we’re checking the flag for require MFA on the account setting page? Either that or we didn’t flip the env var properly in all the required services. If you go to your accounts setting page right now, it forces you to pick an MFA option before you can see anything.

@ChrisM
1. AIHub prod is still running the 23.35 release, where the account settings page just shows the MFA. After we push 23.37 to prod, we'll have a bit nicer UIs (showing basic info, api keys, usage and billings, etc). We should be pushing 23.37 soon (GA scheduled yesterday)
2. Even after the push, if users decide to set up MFA, they can still setup via SMS. We decided not to fix this because:
    a. If the user can't get the SMS message, they can't set up MFA anyway so they won't get blocked in future logins
    b. We hope that twilio can fix this problem soon so.
